intro: Amitostigma kaiyangense, commonly known as the Kaiyang lily, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
